page.title: 07BULMER TYE
page.content: THERE WAS A VERY LARGE WASTE OR GREEN AT BULMER TYE UNTIL THE 1840S.IT WAS ENCLOSED THEN TO PROVIDE ALLOTMENTS & ONLY PLOUGH GREEN A TRIANGULAR PIECE NEAR THE MEETING OF THE HEDINGHAM & HALSTEAD ROADS REMAINS.AROUND THIS FORMER GREEN ARE A NUMBER OF OLDER TIMBER FRAMED HOUSES & A FORMER PUB THE PLOUGH. BULMER'S LAST SURVIVING GENERAL SHOP IS IN PARK LANE JIST OFF THE A131 WHICH ROAD THE FOX INN SERVES.THE BIG HOUSE, THE AUBERIES,WHERE GAINSBOROUGH PAINTED HIS MR & MRS ANDREWS,IS STILL WELL WOODED & ALTHOUGH THIS ESTATE HAS SOME VERY LARGE FIELDS THE CHARCTER OF THE WORKING PARKSCAPE PAINTED BY GAINSBOROUGH IN THE 18TH C.HAS NOT GREATLY CHANGED.THE MAIN ROAD HAS ALWAYS BEEN A BUSY ROUTE TO LONDON FROM E.ANGLIA.ACCIDENTS ARE FREQUENT.
